climbs.name: West Face
climbs.fa: Dan Davis, Stan Shepard, 1961. FFA: Peter Croft, 1984

content.description: This was described in 1961: start at center of face, angle left on steep slab till on left corner of the face, then return to center and straight up over the overhang and directly to the top. There is a chimney at the start.
content.protection: There was a 1/4" bolt on the FA, 5 bolts added on FFA which says something about the nature of protection on the face. Gear to 3". Communal anchor on top.

content.description: Starts with tight chimney at south corner of tower and must go up south face.
content.protection: was done with pitons and 4 bolts added on lead which may or may not still be there?

climbs.name: North Face
climbs.fa: Dan Davis, 1961. FFA : Alec Gibbons, Brian Behle, 2008

content.description: Starts on the left side of the face and angles to the right, mostly up the center. 1961 ascent added 3 bolts, new cleaned rebolted line has 6 bolts.
content.protection: gear to 1" and 6 bolts. I am guessing they added the 1 good bolt to the anchor.

content.description: Same start as for South Face, in the chimney, then wanders left onto the south face following 3 bolts up the SW arete.
content.location: SE corner of tower near the ascent up to the notch.

climbs.name: East Face
climbs.fa: Pete Schoening, Joe Hieb, Wes Grande, Ralph Widrig 1948. FFA: Eric Bjornstad, Dan Davis, 1961

content.description:
1st ascent of the tower in 1948 was this route.

The free ascent in 1961 was considered 5.8 while placing pitons. There was an assortment of 1/4" bolts and fixed pins. Some relics remain, but I would not trust them much. The start is the physical crux, there are pro placements up there, stemming and chimney technique get you up it. There is a chock stone mid way up that made me nervous, seems to be wedged in.
content.protection: Cams and nuts to 3" . An old anchor with a bright SS bolt added in 2008 for the rap off.
content.location: Starts at the notch between the tower and the main wall.
